answers.content_html: The current will double.
answers.feedback_html: Yes, this is correct because current is proportional to the voltage. As voltage doubles, current doubles.

answers.content_html: The current will increase by half.
answers.feedback_html: Current is proportional to the charge.

answers.content_html: The current will decrease by half.
answers.feedback_html: Current is proportional to the charge. How can the current through the circuit decrease when the voltage is increasing?

answers.content_html: The current will decrease by a factor of two.
answers.feedback_html: The relationship between current and voltage is directly proportional.

stem_html: If you double the voltage across an ohmic resistor, how does the current through the resistor change?

answers.content_html: {-9.8}\,\text{m/s}
answers.feedback_html: It is correct that the y-component of the acceleration of an object experiencing projectile motion is acceleration due to gravity but consider the unit of acceleration correctly.

answers.content_html: {-9.8}\,\text{m/s}^2
answers.feedback_html: The y-component of the acceleration of an object experiencing projectile motion is {-9.8}\,\text{m/s}^2

answers.content_html: 9.8\,\text{m/s}
answers.feedback_html: Consider the unit of acceleration due to gravity correctly.

answers.content_html: 9.8\,\text{m/s}^2
answers.feedback_html: Consider the fact that the acceleration due to gravity is acting towards the Earth, in the direction opposite to the direction of motion.

stem_html: Using the conventional choice for positive and negative axes described in the text, what is the y-component of the acceleration of an object experiencing projectile motion?

answers.content_html: Direct current flows continuously in every direction whereas alternating current flows in one direction.
answers.feedback_html: Direct current cannot change its direction.

answers.content_html: Direct current flows continuously in one direction whereas alternating current reverses its direction at regular time intervals.
answers.feedback_html: The direct current flows in one direction while alternating current changes its direction at regular interval of time.

answers.content_html: Both direct and alternating current flow in one direction but the magnitude of direct current is fixed whereas the magnitude of alternating current changes at regular intervals of time.
answers.feedback_html: No, alternating current changes its direction at regular interval of time.

answers.content_html: Both direct and alternating current changes its direction of flow but the magnitude of direct current is fixed whereas the magnitude of alternating current changes at regular intervals of time.
answers.feedback_html: No, direct current do not changes its direction of flow.

stem_html: What is the difference between direct current and alternating current?

answers.content_html: The electrons flow from the negative terminal of the battery to the positive terminal of the battery.
answers.feedback_html: The positive charge flows from the positive terminal to the negative terminal of the battery. So electron flows from negative terminal of the battery to the positive terminal.

answers.content_html: The electrons flow from the positive terminal of the battery to the negative terminal of the battery.
answers.feedback_html: No, the positive charge flows from the positive terminal to the negative terminal of the battery.

stem_html: You connect a resistor across a battery. In which direction do the electrons flow?

answers.content_html: The reaction stops.
answers.feedback_html: Enzymes are macromolecules that speed up the chemical reactions by lowering activation energy barrier. So if an enzyme is not working in a chemical reaction that needs it, then the reaction will eventually proceed very slowly, but not stop.

answers.content_html: The reaction proceeds, but much more slowly.
answers.feedback_html: If the enzyme needed for the reaction will not be available, then the reaction will occur slowly, potentially so slowly that an organism may die before the reaction is complete.

answers.content_html: The reaction proceeds faster without the interference.
answers.feedback_html: Check if a reaction can proceed without the interference of an enzyme that is needed in the reaction.

answers.content_html: There is no change in the reaction rate.
answers.feedback_html: The reaction will not proceed in a timely fashion if the enzyme needed by the reaction is not provided in the reaction.

stem_html: What happens if an enzyme is not functioning in a chemical reaction in a living organism that needs it?

answers.content_html: Ohm’s law says that the current through a resistor equals the voltage across the resistor multiplied by the resistance of the resistor.
answers.feedback_html: The mathematical expression for the Ohm’s law is \text{V}=\text{IR}.

answers.content_html: Ohm’s law says that the voltage across a resistor equals the current through the resistor multiplied by the resistance of the resistor.
answers.feedback_html: The mathematical expression for the Ohm’s law is \text{V}=\text{IR}.

answers.content_html: Ohm’s law says that the resistance of the resistor equals the current through the resistor multiplied by the voltage across a resistor.
answers.feedback_html: The mathematical expression for the Ohm’s law is \text{V}=\text{IR}.

answers.content_html: Ohm’s law says that the voltage across a resistor equals the square of the current through the resistor multiplied by the resistance of the resistor.
answers.feedback_html: The mathematical expression for the Ohm’s law is \text{V}=\text{IR}.

stem_html: Give a verbal expression for Ohm’s law.

answers.content_html: mRNA
answers.feedback_html: mRNA contains more nucleotide sequences in comparison to the other RNA

answers.content_html: microRNA
answers.feedback_html: microRNAs are the smallest RNA molecules and their role involves the regulation of gene expression.

answers.content_html: rRNA
answers.feedback_html: rRNA does not contain least number of molecules in nucleotide sequences.

answers.content_html: tRNA
answers.feedback_html: microRNA is smaller than tRNA

stem_html: What is the smallest type of RNA?

answers.content_html: Electric current is the charge that passes through a conductor per unit time. The direction of the current is defined to be the direction in which positive charge would flow.
answers.feedback_html: Current is defined as charge flowing through a conductor per unit time and direction of current is defined to be the direction in which positive charges would flow.

answers.content_html: Electric current is the charges that move in a conductor. The direction of the current is defined to be the direction in which positive charge would flow.
answers.feedback_html: Charges that move in a conductor can produce current but the amount of current is defined as the charge that passes through a conductor per unit time.

answers.content_html: Electric current is the charge that passes through a conductor per unit time. The direction of the current is defined to be the direction in which negative charge would flow.
answers.feedback_html: No, the direction of current is defined to be the direction in which positive charge would flow.

answers.content_html: Electric current is the charges that move in a conductor. The direction of the current is defined to be the direction in which negative charge would flow.
answers.feedback_html: No, the direction of current is defined to be the direction in which positive charge would flow.

stem_html: Describe the relationship between current and charge. Include an explanation of how the direction of the current is defined.

answers.content_html: astronomy
answers.feedback_html: Astronomy is a branch of natural science that studies the celestial objects and the phenomenon related to them.

answers.content_html: biology
answers.feedback_html: Biology is the study of life and living organisms. It is a branch of natural sciences.

answers.content_html: computer science
answers.feedback_html: Computer science is a practical and scientific approach to computation and its application. It is not considered a natural science.

answers.content_html: physics
answers.feedback_html: Physics is a branch of natural science that studies matter.

stem_html: Which of the following sciences is not considered a natural science?
